title: V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath - NDTV
summary:
V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath

Date: New Delhi

The Centre has appointed V Narayanan as the new chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation and Secretary, Department of Space. Mr Narayanan will take over from S Somanath, the current head of the organisation, on January 14.

  • V Narayanan is currently the head of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • He played a key role in the development of India's cryogenic engine technology.
  • Mr Narayanan aims to take ISRO to greater heights with a clear roadmap for the future.
  • He has been with ISRO since 1984 and has held various significant positions.
  • S Somanath, the outgoing chief, led ISRO during significant missions including the successful Moon landing.
“We have a clear roadmap for India and I hope to take ISRO to greater heights as we have great talent,” - V Narayanan

In conclusion, V Narayanan's appointment marks a new chapter in ISRO's leadership, promising continued advancements in India's space exploration efforts.
newTitle: V Narayanan Appointed New ISRO Chief, Will Take Over From S Somanath

title: Isro to get new chief: Dr V Narayanan to take over from S Somnath on Jan 14 - India Today
summary:
Dr V Narayanan Appointed as New Isro Chief Starting January 14

Publication Date: Jan 7, 2025

Source: India Today

Dr V Narayanan has been named the next chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro). He will take over from S Somnath on January 14.

  • Dr V Narayanan is currently the Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • He has nearly four decades of experience in various key positions at Isro.
  • Expert in rocket and spacecraft propulsion, he led the successful C25 Cryogenic Project of the GSLV Mk III.
  • Under his guidance, the LPSC has delivered 183 Liquid Propulsion Systems for Isro missions.
  • His contributions include work on the propulsion systems for Chandrayaan-2 and Chandrayaan-3.
“The leadership of Dr Narayanan marks a significant new chapter in Isro's future endeavors.”

Dr V Narayanan's extensive experience and contributions to Isro make him an ideal choice for leading the organization into its next phase of space exploration.
newTitle: Dr V Narayanan Appointed as New Isro Chief Starting January 14

title: PM Modi to launch Pravasi Bharatiya Express on Wednesday | All about the special train - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi to Launch Pravasi Bharatiya Express on Wednesday

Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will flag off the Pravasi Bharatiya Express, a special tourist train for the Indian diaspora, from New Delhi’s Safdarjung railway station. This launch coincides with the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention in Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

  • The Pravasi Bharatiya Express is designed for the Indian diaspora aged 45 to 65 years.
  • The train will travel for three weeks to multiple destinations including Ayodhya, Patna, Gaya, Varanasi, and more.
  • The launch date, January 9, commemorates Mahatma Gandhi's return to India from South Africa in 1915.
  • Accommodating 156 passengers, the tour aims to connect the Indian diaspora with their roots.
  • Organized under the 'Pravasi Teerth Darshan Yojana', it collaborates with IRCTC.
The Indian diaspora has emerged as one of the largest sources of remittance in the world. The Indian diaspora stands at 35.4 million, including 19.5 million Persons of Indian Origins (PIOs) and 15.8 million NRIs.

In summary, this initiative is expected to strengthen ties between the Indian diaspora and their homeland while boosting tourism in Odisha.
newTitle: PM Modi to Launch Pravasi Bharatiya Express for Indian Diaspora

title: Delhi Elections 2025 Date Announcement: Delhi To Vote On February 5, Counting On February 8 - NDTV
summary:
Delhi Elections 2025 Date Announcement: Voting on February 5, Results on February 8

Publication Date: January 7, 2025
Source: NDTV

The Delhi Assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, 2025, with counting set for February 8. AAP and BJP leaders express their confidence in the upcoming elections.

  • The BJP claims a 'double-engine government' will be established following the elections.
  • AAP maintains that it will continue working for the people regardless of the cancellation of the Chief Minister's official residence.
  • Over 13,000 polling stations will be operational in Delhi.
  • The Chief Election Commissioner announced expectations of reaching a billion voters soon.
  • Notable candidates include AAP's Arvind Kejriwal, BJP's Virendra Sachdeva, and Congress’s Alka Lamba.
“On February 5, 1 crore 55 lakh 24 thousand 858 voters will cast their votes to build a new Delhi, a better Delhi, and a beautiful Delhi.” - Virendra Sachdeva

The upcoming elections are crucial for determining the future governance of Delhi, with major implications for the state's political landscape.
newTitle: Delhi Elections 2025 Date Announcement: Voting on February 5, Results on February 8

title: EP Jayarajan autobiography case: Kerala High Court slams DC Books but grants relief to editor - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Grants Bail to DC Books Editor in EP Jayarajan Autobiography Case

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 4:11 pm

The Kerala High Court has granted anticipatory bail to Sreekumar AV, a senior Deputy Editor with DC Books, amid allegations of unauthorized publication of CPI(M) leader EP Jayarajan's autobiography.

  • The court stated that Sreekumar's arrest may not be necessary as the offenses carry a maximum sentence of five years.
  • Justice PV Kunhikrishnan referenced a Supreme Court ruling emphasizing that arrests should be minimal when maximum punishment is under seven years.
  • The case arose following a complaint from Jayarajan claiming DC Books published his autobiography without consent.
  • The publisher's action raised concerns regarding breach of confidentiality and privacy.
  • Sreekumar contends his involvement was limited, emphasizing he acted in his professional capacity by passing on materials to the editorial board.
“I am surprised to see that DC Books published such a notice without the consent of the writer.” - Justice PV Kunhikrishnan

In conclusion, the High Court's decision indicates a careful examination of the legal principles surrounding unauthorized publications, balancing the rights of writers and publishers.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Grants Bail to DC Books Editor in EP Jayarajan Autobiography Case

Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar made headlines with his unique approach of using 'shayari' (poetry) during the announcement of the 2025 Delhi election dates. This method not only entertained but also highlighted key issues around the electoral process.

  • CEC Rajiv Kumar's media interaction is marked by his use of Urdu poetry.
  • He recited three poetries while addressing concerns about EVMs and electoral integrity.
  • His quotes addressed the importance of questioning and accountability in the electoral process.
  • Kumar's poetic style has previously gone viral, capturing public interest during significant announcements.
All the concerns raised by Congress party have been answered by CEC Rajiv Kumar through his shayaris. 3 shayari for all the questions and accountability done…! — Venisha G Kiba (@KibaVenisha) January 7, 2025

The event showcases how CEC Rajiv Kumar blends tradition with modern engagement, making the electoral process more relatable and approachable.

title: Amid Manmohan row, Centre to set up memorial to Pranab Mukherjee - The Tribune India
Chief Minister condoles sudden demise of son of Tahir Ajaz - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Chief Minister Condoles Sudden Demise of Son of Tahir Ajaz

Date: January 07, 2023 | Source: New Delhi

Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has expressed profound grief over the sudden demise of Imad Tahir, a student of Class 10 and son of Tahir Ajaz, Additional Secretary in the Chief Minister’s Secretariat. The Chief Minister extended his heartfelt sympathy to the bereaved family during this tragic time.

  • The Chief Minister expressed deep sorrow over the loss.
  • Imad Tahir passed away at his residence in Srinagar.
  • Omar Abdullah assured support and solidarity to the grieving family.
  • All staff members of the Chief Minister's Secretariat also extended their condolences.
“The news of Imad’s untimely passing has left me at a loss for words. I can only pray that the family finds the strength and forbearance to cope with this devastating tragedy.” – Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

This tragic event has been felt deeply within the community, as the Chief Minister and his staff convey their condolences.
newTitle: Chief Minister Expresses Condolences for the Loss of Imad Tahir

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has mounted a fresh attack on Delhi Chief Minister Atishi, alleging that her family has supported Afzal Guru, who was convicted in a Parliament attack. This comes amid ongoing tensions between the BJP and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP).

title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya as Delhi High Court Chief Justice - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Collegium recommends Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya as Chief Justice of Delhi High Court

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 3:28 pm

The Supreme Court collegium has recommended the appointment of Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya as Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court. If approved, he will replace Justice Vibhu Bakhru, who is currently acting Chief Justice.

  • The collegium suggested transferring Justice Upadhyaya from his current position as Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court.
  • The Delhi High Court currently has 35 judges, well below its sanctioned strength of 60.
  • Recent appointments of two advocates to the Delhi High Court were notified by the Central government on January 6.
newTitle: Supreme Court Collegium Recommends Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya as Chief Justice of Delhi High Court

title: Collegium recommends appointment of Justice K Vinod Chandran as Supreme Court judge - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Collegium Recommends Justice K Vinod Chandran for Supreme Court Appointment

Publication Date: Tuesday
Source: Bar and Bench

The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of K Vinod Chandran, Chief Justice of Patna High Court, as a judge of the Supreme Court.

  • The recommendation was made by the Collegium led by Chief Justice of India, Sanjiv Khanna.
  • Justice Chandran has over 11 years of experience as a High Court judge and has been the Chief Justice of Patna since March 2023.
  • The Collegium noted the lack of representation from the Kerala High Court in the Supreme Court.
  • Justice Chandran ranks 13th in the combined all-India seniority of High Court judges, and 1st among judges from the Kerala High Court.
"He has served as a Judge of the High Court for more than 11 years and as a Chief Justice of a big High Court for more than a year. During his long tenure as a Judge and Chief Justice of the High Court, Justice Chandran has acquired significant experience in diverse fields of law."

His appointment helps to fill the current void of Kerala High Court representation in the Supreme Court.
newTitle: Collegium Recommends Justice K Vinod Chandran for Supreme Court Appointment

title: BREAKING| SC Collegium Recommends Elevation Of Patna HC CJ Vinod Chandran As Supreme Court Judge - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Collegium Recommends Justice K Vinod Chandran for Elevation

In a significant development, the Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the elevation of Justice K Vinod Chandran, currently the Chief Justice of the Patna High Court, to the Supreme Court.

  • Justice K Vinod Chandran was appointed as a High Court Judge on 8th November 2011.
  • He became the Chief Justice of the Patna High Court on 29th March 2023.
  • The Collegium's recommendation acknowledges the lack of representation from the High Court of Kerala in the Supreme Court.

“Justice Vinod Chandran has acquired significant experience in diverse fields of law.”

title: Memorial to be set up for Pranab Mukherjee at Rashtriya Smriti, daughter Sharmistha thanks PM Modi - The Hindu
summary:
Centre earmarks memorial for Pranab Mukherjee

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Centre has designated a site at the Rashtriya Smriti complex for a memorial dedicated to the late President Pranab Mukherjee.

  • The designation was confirmed by the Union Ministry of Housing and Urban Development in a letter to Mukherjee's daughter, Sharmishtha Mukherjee.
  • The memorial comes amid discussions regarding a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh following his passing.
  • Sharmishtha Mukherjee expressed her gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the decision, emphasizing that they did not request the memorial.
  • Pranab Mukherjee passed away on August 31, 2020, and was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 2019.
“Immensely touched by this unexpected but truly gracious gesture by PM,” said Sharmishtha Mukherjee.

This memorial not only honors Mukherjee's legacy but also highlights ongoing discussions about memorials for prominent leaders in India.
newTitle: Centre earmarks memorial for Pranab Mukherjee

title: Bengaluru techie suicide: Denying grandson's custody, SC says deceased's mother 'stranger to child' - Hindustan Times
Govt Lays Out New Rules Of How Your Vehicles Will Be Scrapped After Reaching End-Of-Life - News18
summary:
Govt Lays Out New Rules Of How Your Vehicles Will Be Scrapped After Reaching End-Of-Life

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: News18

The government announced the Environment Protection (End-of-Life Vehicles) Rules, 2025, which will be enforced starting April 1, 2025. These rules apply to various stakeholders involved in the scrapping process.

  • The rules will impact vehicle producers, registered owners, and scrapping facilities.
  • Owners must ensure vehicles are dropped at designated centers within 180 days of reaching end-of-life.
  • Environmental compensation will be imposed for non-compliance.
  • A centralized online portal will be established for registrations and returns.
The environmental compensation will be used to restore damage to the environment caused by non-compliance.

The new measures aim to create a structured approach for vehicle scrapping and improve environmental compliance.
newTitle: New Rules for Scrapping End-of-Life Vehicles Announced by Government

title: Supreme Court refuses to hear plea against Bihar PSC exam; asks petitioner to move High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court refuses to hear plea against Bihar PSC exam; asks petitioner to move High Court

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 1:24 pm

The Supreme Court has rejected a petition alleging irregularities in the Bihar Public Service Commission’s 70th Preliminary Examination and police actions against protesting candidates. The court advised that the petitioners approach the High Court instead.

  • The Supreme Court dismissed the petition concerning irregularities in the BPSC exam.
  • The Court advised petitioners to seek resolution through the High Court under Article 226.
  • Protests arose following allegations of a question paper leak in the Combined Competitive Examination, held on December 13.
  • Over 10,000 candidates are set to undergo fresh examinations due to the protests.
  • The BPSC dismissed allegations of a leak as a conspiracy to disrupt the examination process.
“We believe it would be appropriate for the petitioner to approach the concerned High Court under Article 226,” the Bench remarked.

This decision emphasizes the judicial process regarding examination disputes and highlights ongoing tensions in Bihar regarding the conduct of public service examinations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Denies Appeal Against Bihar PSC Exam Irregularities

title: Centre earmarks site for memorial of Pranab Mukherjee, ex-President's daughter thanks PM Modi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Memorial Site Approved for Pranab Mukherjee, Daughter Thanks PM Modi

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Narendra Modi government has allocated a site at the 'Rashtriya Smriti' complex for a memorial for former President Pranab Mukherjee. His daughter, Sharmistha Mukherjee, expressed gratitude towards PM Modi for this decision.

  • The memorial will be located at the Rajghat precinct, a significant area in Delhi.
  • Pranab Mukherjee served as the President of India from 2012 to 2017 and was awarded the Bharat Ratna.
  • Sharmistha Mukherjee publicly thanked PM Modi, highlighting that the memorial was unexpected and appreciated.
  • She criticized the Congress party for its response to her father's passing in comparison to their treatment of other leaders.
“It’s more cherished considering that we didn’t ask for it. Immensely touched by this unexpected but truly gracious gesture by PM,” Sharmistha Mukherjee said.

This memorial symbolizes the respect and honor for Pranab Mukherjee’s contributions to the nation, as expressed through the government’s decision and the heartfelt response from his family.
newTitle: Memorial Site Approved for Pranab Mukherjee, Daughter Thanks PM Modi

title: 11% weekly returns? Here's how Mumbai's Torres Jewellers duped investors in ₹13.48 crore fraud | Today News - Mint
summary:
Investors Duped in ₹13.48 Crore Fraud by Mumbai's Torres Jewellers

Date: [Insert Publication Date]

Source: Live Mint

A major financial scam has emerged in Mumbai involving Torres Jewellers, which has allegedly defrauded investors of over ₹13.48 crore. The fraud came to light after a vegetable vendor from Nariman Point lodged a complaint at the Shivaji Park police station.

Following the complaint, a crowd of investors from the Mira-Bhayander area reached the offices of Torres Jewellers, where they found the shops shut, raising concerns about their investments.

Key Points:

  • Investment schemes launched in February 2024 promised high returns (up to 11% weekly).
  • Torres Jewellers ceased payouts two weeks ago, leading to investor panic.
  • The complainant alleged the fraud occurred between June 21, 2024, and December 30, 2024.
  • Investors initially attracted to the offers are now facing potential losses.
  • The company claims evidence of conspiracy against them, citing employee misconduct.
“It’s a huge shock for us; we trusted them with our savings.” - Affected Investor

This scam highlights the risks involved in investment schemes that promise unusually high returns, emphasizing the need for vigilance among investors in financial markets.
newTitle: Investors Duped in ₹13.48 Crore Fraud by Mumbai's Torres Jewellers

title: How Bhubaneswar got ready to welcome 5,000 NRIs for Pravasi Bharatiya Divas - The Indian Express
summary:
Bhubaneswar Prepares for 5,000 NRIs at Pravasi Bharatiya Divas 2025

Publication Date: Date of event inauguration not provided. Source: Indian Express

Bhubaneswar is gearing up to host the 18th edition of the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (PBD), aiming to welcome around 5,000 Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) along with dignitaries from various countries.

  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the event at Janata Maidan.
  • Trinidad and Tobago President Christine Carla Kangaloo is expected to attend the inauguration.
  • This is the first time Odisha is hosting the PBD, which celebrates the contributions of the overseas Indian community.
  • Security measures include 90 platoons of state police and 12 companies of CAPF.
  • Various cultural events and exhibitions are planned during the three-day convention.
“The Chief Minister and his team have made fantastic arrangements. The preparations are grand and beautiful.” - S Jaishankar, External Affairs Minister

The Pravasi Bharatiya Divas aims to enhance Odisha's image and attract investments through this grand event.

title: Assam: India rescuers race to save men stuck in flooded rat-hole mine - BBC.com
summary:
Assam: India rescuers race to save men stuck in flooded rat-hole mine

Publication Date: Not specified Source: BBC News

Rescue operations are ongoing for miners trapped in a flooded coal mine in Assam, with fears that three of the nine men inside may be dead.

  • Rescue teams have spotted bodies but have been unable to retrieve them.
  • The miners were trapped following a flooding incident during the early hours of Monday.
  • Despite a ban on rat-hole mining in India since 2014, illegal operations persist in the region.
“Senior officials of Indian army will also be reaching the site to co-ordinate with the civil administration,” the army stated.

The situation continues to develop, with local authorities and the army actively involved in rescue efforts.
newTitle: Rescue Efforts Underway for Miners Trapped in Flooded Assam Coal Mine

title: Marriage Equality Case| New Bench Of Supreme Court To Consider Review Petitions On January 9 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Set to Review Marriage Equality Petitions on January 9

Publication Date: January 9, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court will hear review petitions against the verdict that refused to recognize queer marriages in India. A new bench, which includes Justice PS Narasimha from the original bench, will consider these petitions in chambers.

  • The Supreme Court denied legal recognition for queer marriages on October 17, 2023.
  • The court stated that the matter should be decided by the legislature.
  • The Union of India is expected to examine the rights of queer unions.
  • Despite the denial of marriage recognition, the court acknowledged the right of queer couples to cohabit safely.
  • Review petitions were filed claiming the original judgment failed to protect fundamental rights.
The Court recognizes that the Petitioners' fundamental rights are being violated by the State through discrimination but fails to take the logical next step of prohibiting this discrimination.

This forthcoming review highlights ongoing debates around queer rights and legal recognition in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court Set to Review Marriage Equality Petitions on January 9

title: Engineer Dies in Explosion at ONGC Gas Gathering Station in Assam's Jorhat - Pratidin Time
summary:
Engineer Dies in Explosion at ONGC Gas Gathering Station in Assam's Jorhat

Publication Date: N/A Source: Pratidin Time

A massive fire broke out at the ONGC Gas Gathering Station (GGS) in Borholla, Sildubi, located in the Titabar area of Jorhat district, Assam, following an explosion inside the facility. The blast led to the rapid spread of flames, engulfing the GGS.

  • Several individuals were seriously injured in the incident.
  • Rahul Dutta, an engineer, succumbed to his injuries while being transported to the hospital in critical condition.
  • Fire tenders are currently working to douse the flames.
  • Media access to the facility has been restricted as the situation is still unfolding.
Reports confirm that one victim, identified as Rahul Dutta, succumbed to his injuries.

This tragic incident highlights the dangers associated with industrial operations and the urgent need for safety measures in gas facilities.
newTitle: Engineer Dies in Explosion at ONGC Gas Gathering Station in Assam's Jorhat

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi alleged that the central government cancelled her allotment of the CM residence just before the assembly elections. Her accusations were met with a rebuttal from the BJP, asserting she was lying.

title: 'No flirting with cashier, no digging nose': Pune cafe's no-nonsense rules will leave you in splits - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pune Cafe's Hilarious Menu Rules Go Viral

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The menu of an Irani café in Pune has gone viral due to its quirky and humorous rules, highlighting the café's no-nonsense theme along with its culinary offerings.

  • The café is famous for its old-world charm and simple menu of chai and bun maska.
  • A social media post revealed the café's amusing menu rules, including: 'No flirting with cashier', 'No mobile games', and 'No digging nose'.
  • Many of the rules reflect common issues faced by cafés, while others are more comedic in nature.
  • The café's owner has garnered attention on social media, with users sharing their reactions and jokes about the rules.
“No flirting with cashier” still intrigues me what must’ve happened to put that up. Their cashier is an uncle.

The humorous rules of the Pune café resonate with many people, bringing both laughter and curiosity about the stories behind them.
